body.p: “How contagious are boys’ games! A short time ago they were spinning tops “,” as I saw and heard “,” all the country over. Now every boy has a stick curved at the end “,” a hawkie “,” in his hand “,”whether in yards or in distant lanes I meet them.”
PE 12, pg. 155 / 31 July-25 November 1857/ NNPM MA 1302:30 / T vol. # XXIV / PDF # XVI / JIX & JX
